Package engine.forPiece

Class Queen

java.lang.Object
engine.forPiece.Piece
engine.forPiece.Queen
public final class Queen extends Piece
The Queen class represents a queen chess piece. It is capable of moving diagonally, vertically, and horizontally on the chessboard. It provides methods for calculating legal moves, evaluating positional bonuses, and creating new instances after valid moves. This class is designed to encapsulate the behavior and attributes specific to a queen piece in the context of a chess game.
Author:
Aaron Ho

      piecePosition - The initial position of the queen on the board.
      isFirstMove - True if this is the queen's first move, false otherwise.

  • Method Details

    • computeCandidates

      private static Map<Integer,MoveUtils.Line[]> computeCandidates()
      Computes a map of precomputed candidate move lines for each tile on the board. These lines represent the valid move paths for a queen piece on the chessboard.
      Returns:
      A map of tile positions to precomputed candidate move lines.

    • calculateLegalMoves
